dsurround.command.dump.success: Dump of %1$s §2succeeded§r.  Data can be found in %2$s
dsurround.command.reload.success: Resources reload §2succeeded§r. Examine log for details.
dsurround.command.reload.failure: Resources reload §4failed§r.  Examine log for details.
text.autoconfig.dsurround.title: §6Dynamic Surroundings§r Configuration Options
text.autoconfig.dsurround.option.logging: Configuration options for modifying logging behavior
Enables/disables debug logging of the mod
Bitmask for toggling various debug traces
text.autoconfig.dsurround.option.soundSy: Configuration options for modifying Minecraft's Sound System behavior
The number of sound channels to reserve for streaming sounds (music, biome sounds, records, etc.)
Ticks between culled sound events (0 to disable culling)
text.autoconfig.dsurround.option.thunder: Options for defining how Dynamic Surroundings will modify thunder and lightning effects
Enables replacement of thunder sounds with Dynamic Surroundings' version
text.autoconfig.dsurround.option.blockEf: Distance that will be scanned when generating block effects
Enable/disable steam column effect when liquids hit hot sources
Enable/disable flame jets produced over lava and nether wart
text.autoconfig.dsurround.option.particl: Configuration options for tweaking particle behavior
Enable/disable suppressing player potion particles in first person
Enable/disable showing of projectile particle trails
text.autoconfig.dsurround.option.enhance: Configuration options for enhanced sound processing
Enable/disable enhanced sound processing (reverb, occlusion, etc)
Enable/disable HRTF sound processing if OpenAL feature is available
Enable/disable on the fly conversion of stereo sounds to mono as needed
Number of background threads to use for enhanced sound processing (0 means use internal default)
Enable/disable sound occlusion processing (sound muffling behind blocks)
dsurround.text.soundconfig.caption: §bCaption:§r §o%1$s
dsurround.text.soundconfig.cull.help: Marking a sound as CULL will limit the play to a single instance over a short period of time, reducing the overall load of the sound engine as well as ears.  Will only apply to sounds played through the Minecraft sound engine.
dsurround.text.soundconfig.block.help: A sound marked as BLOCK will be prevented from playing.  Will only apply to sounds played through the Minecraft sound engine.
dsurround.text.soundconfig.play.help: Plays the sound with the volume scaled by the volume scaling factor.  Does not apply any sound category volume modifiers.
dsurround.text.soundconfig.volume.help: Set a volume scaling factor that gets applied when calculating the volume of a sound.  Increase to make quiet sounds louder; reduce to make loud sounds quieter.  x1.00 is normal volume.
